Name: Atlantique
Description: Located in the southern part of Benin, this region is home to the nation s largest city, Cotonou, and serves as the economic hub of the country.

Name: Borgou
Description: A northern region of Benin known for its agricultural activities, particularly in the production of maize, cotton, and livestock.

Name: Alibori
Description: A region in the northeastern part of Benin, Alibori is an agricultural area, with an emphasis on cotton and livestock farming.

Name: Mono
Description: This region, located in the southwestern part of the country, is known for its beautiful beaches and agricultural products like cashews and cotton.

Name: Couffo
Description: Couffo is a southern region characterized by agriculture and is known for its cotton production.

Name: Zou
Description: Zou is a central region in Benin, known for its rich cultural heritage and agricultural products such as cotton, maize, and yams.

Name: Collines
Description: Located in the center of Benin, Collines is known for its hilly terrain and agricultural activities, especially in the production of maize and yams.

Name: Donga
Description: A northern region of Benin, Donga is known for its agriculture, especially in the production of yams, cassava, and maize.

Name: Atacora
Description: Located in the northwest, Atacora is an area rich in forests and wildlife, as well as home to various ethnic groups.
